Hard ones, soft ones, liquid ones, and anything you can think of was freely distributed at those parties." <br><br> "You keep saying used to, so... she doesn't do that anymore?" You ask. <br><br> "That's the thing. Two years ago, everything stopped. No more parties, no more drugs, and she even checked herself into a rehab facility where she stayed for almost a year." <br><br> "Huh!" <br><br> [[Next|c1_files_tess2]]"Huh, indeed. As of now, I can't find any receipts for drugs or parties. She seems to be keeping to herself now, and all she does is contacting adoption agencies." <br><br> "Something happened two years ago." <br><br> "That's what I think too. Either someone died at one of her parties, and she felt guilty and checked herself into rehab, or she just grew a conscience two years ago and is now reformed." <br><br> "That doesn't explain the adoption calls." <br><br> "A reformed Tess may want to adopt a child, or want to put a child up for adoption if she currently has a child. Better yet, if it was a young mother who died at one of her parties, those calls could be her way of trying to find the baby to do right by the victim." <br><br> "All good possibilities," you say. <br><br> "There's one more. She could have found out that she is not your uncle's biological child, so she is just trying to find her birth father," $bod_name chuckles. "?Kevbrohis_her name is Raine, but I would rather we talk about ?kevbrohim_her another day. Now please try to rest. I'll be outside if you need anything." <br><br> $bod_name walks out of your bedroom, leaving you alone. Rest, sleep, maybe if you focus on those words long enough you'll end up in dreamland. <br><br> As you painfully toss and turn in your bed, you hear your phone chirp. You bring it out from buried under the covers, only to find a text message from an unknown sender displayed on the screen. <br><br> You quickly unlock your phone to read the full message. <br><br> [[Next|c6_home5]]<b>Text From A Stranger...</b> <br><br> Hello, $namemc $surnamemc, aka ?You_var. You don't know who I am, but I know who you are, and I also know that we have a lot in common. <br><br> With high interest I've been following the debacle with your family because I'm hoping to do business with you in the near future. <br><br> As a potential future business partner, I'm sending my condolences for the loss of your family members. It's the killer who went on a path of vengeance and murdered some of your family members. <br><br> You see Detective Mars pacing in the room, and sitting in a chair facing the killer is a muscular man with a man-bun, without a doubt Mars' partner. <br><br> You crank up the volume of your phone and listen to the interrogation. <br><br> [[Next|c6_feed2]]<b>Now Playing As Mars...</b> <br><br> "Okay, Webb," you say, addressing the suspect, "this is my partner Lance, I know he already read you your rights. His face is still red with bruises collected from when the bodyguard and you tackled him down at Tess' Penthouse. <br><br> "I don't need a lawyer," Webb grunts. "I'm ready to talk. Ask me anything you want." <br><br> "Okay, let's go to the beginning," Lance asks, "how did it all start?" <br><br> "It all started because one of the $surnamemc killed my wife!" "c6_home11">><</choice_shown>> /% [[c6_wit]] [[c6_home11]] %/<b>Now Playing As The Witness...</b> <br><br> The taxi driver curses you as he drives away, and you do your best to ignore him. But when you're broke and have a two-year-old to feed, well... you can't be picky. <br><br> [[Next|c6_wit2]]Feet heavy, you follow the path that leads to the long driveway. But before we do all that... would anyone like to share with the room their own evidence on who the killer might be?" <br><br> An uneasy quiet settles over the conference room, but soon, your father stands up to speak. <br><br> "On behalf of my wife $esther, Mira, and <<if $susttus eq "Deceased">> Tess... rest her soul," your father manages a sad face. "We all believed that the killer was my brother Robert. <<else>> Dominik... rest his soul," your father manages a sad face while the other twin clenches his jaw at hearing the name of his dead brother. "We all believed that the killer was Robert. <</if>> Since he is dead and as a sign of respect, I will not present the evidence that I have against him." <br><br> [[Next|c7_conf5]]It's unbelievable that your father is going with the scapegoat plan even after everything that happened, but you remain quiet and wait to hear what comes next out of his mouth. <br><br> "I don't know what kind of proof you have in that envelope, $law_name," your father continues, "but Robert was the real killer. I know that a certain car was used during the commission of that murder, and that my brother wasn't at the estate that night, but believe me when I say that he was the one behind it all." <br><br> Having made his point, $leon settles back into his chair. <br><br> "Thank you, Mr. $surnamemc," $law_name says to your father before glancing around the room. I did what every first born son would do, drop everything and run home to be with my family. <br><br> Of course my father was a mess, especially after finding out that the police had no lead, or if they did, they weren't talking because we found out that the murderer was a billionaire. <br><br> My father started drowning his sorrows with alcohol, and my little brother started acting up while I watched it all unfold, feeling helpless. <br><br> It's terrifying how grief can cripple you, and how losing the pillar of your family can destroy you. <br><br> A couple of months later, my little brother got caught shoplifting and was sent to juvie. <br><br> And that's when everything changed. <br><br> [[Next|c7_ezra2]]With my brother in juvie, we received the visit of a family lawyer, Esq Hamilton Storks. He talked to my father while I stayed away in the other room. He offered money for our troubles, money for the loss of my mother as if she could be replaced with a price tag. <br><br> My father refused the blood money, of course. Instead, he asked for justice. But Esq Storks couldn't offer us justice because he was protecting a killer. <br><br> After the lawyer left our home, we researched his name and found out that he only worked with one family. The $surnamemc family. <br><br> Still, it wasn't hard proof for us to act upon. After all, maybe the wealthy family living up the hill did indeed feel bad for our troubles. <br><br> But the hard proof of their involvement came a couple of days later when we received a called from the director of the <i>Troubled Youth Organization</i> where my little brother was being held. <br><br> [[Next|c7_ezra3]]The director told my father that someone named Florence $surnamemc was donating money to the organization just to keep my little brother comfortable, but we learned that the director pocketed the money instead. <br><br> With that news, we knew for a fact that the $surnamemc family was behind my mother's murder. But still we didn't know which one was guilty. <br><br> That's when we came up with the plot. My father was hired as a doorman, and I applied for the internship. Together and united as one, we executed our plan. <br><br> I snooped around the firm and gathered information, while my father did all the killing. It was the perfect plan, until he got caught... And now... I have to carry on with what he couldn't finish. <br><br> [[Next|c7_ezra4]]<b>Now Playing As Yourself...</b> <br><br> <<include "c7_conf17">> /% [[c7_conf17]] %/"Keep it short, really?" What are you going to do if I don't stop, $bod_name?" <br><br> [[Next|c3_remi_until30]]<i>ABORT! ABORT! ABORT! DANGER ZONE! Well, it's not really a party but a family dinner with the $surnamemc patriarch. <br><br> "<i>I'll only turn 80 once,</i>" the old man had joked. "<i>In lieu of a frivolous party, I want a family dinner at the old estate. I want all of my children and grandchildren to be in attendance. No exceptions.</i>" <br><br> That was Grandpa's way of saying "mandatory attendance," and the family knew all too well not to take those words lightly. Hence the large table is set with eleven chairs. <br><br> [[Next|c3_remi_hen2]]As usual, Grandpa $henry will sit at the end of the table while the rest of the family will spread out on each side. The issue with that statement is that you're not rich, you're wealthy. <br><br> It's easy to assume that being rich equates being wealthy, but it's the wrong assumption. While someone can go to sleep poor and wake up rich, only the people born with a silver spoon in their mouth can wake up wealthy. <br><br> As a member of a wealthy family, your last name is your ID, your passport, and your credit card. A magical word capable of making people around you bend over and cater to your every desire. The sound of it opens doors that are closed to most. It gets others to smile in your presence even if their smiles are fake. <br><br> In short, your last name gets you everything you want. <br><br> [[Next|surname]]Sure, you're not the only wealthy kid around. Better yet, you're not the only family member carrying this name. <br><br> There are a couple of cousins and a sibling, but for what it's worth, the name is: <br><br> <<set _next = "surnamecheck">> <<choice_shown "Pollack." _next>> <<set $surnamemc = "Pollack">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Crowley." _next>> <<set $surnamemc = "Crowley">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Waldorf." _next>> <<set $surnamemc = "Waldorf">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Pepignan." _next>> <<set $surnamemc = "Pepignan">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Madrigal." _next>> <<set $surnamemc = "Madrigal">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Al Saud." _next>> <<set $surnamemc = "Al Saud">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Hilton." _next>> <<set $surnamemc = "Hilton">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Soprano." _next>> <<set $surnamemc = "Soprano">> <</choice_shown>> <br> Or insert rich family name: <<textbox "$surnamemc" "">><<link "Okay" _next>><</link>> /% [[origin]] %/<<if $surnamemc>> <<capfirst "$surnamemc">> Your last name is $surnamemc, is that right? <<else>> <<set $surnamemc = "Pollack">> You didn't insert a family name, so is it all right to assume you belong to the Pollack family? <</if>> <br><br> [[Yes.|origin]] <br> <<back "No, I want to change it.">>For what it's worth, 30.7bn to be exact, the $surnamemc family always gets its way. <br><br> The first generation started in the early 1900, when great-grandpa $surnamemc: <br><br> <<set _next = "prologue2">> <<choice_shown "Emigrated from his European country to the US." _next>> <<set $contry_origin = "European">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Emigrated from his Asian country to the US." _next>> <<set $contry_origin = "Asian">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Emigrated from his Middle Eastern country to the US." _next>> <<set $contry_origin = "Middle Eastern">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Emigrated from his African country to the US." _next>> <<set $contry_origin = "African">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Emigrated from his Latin American country to the US." _next>> <<set $contry_origin = "Latin American">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Emigrated from his Caribbean country to the US." _next>> <<set $contry_origin = "Caribbean">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Decided to leave his Native tribe and move to a big city." _next>> <<set $tribe1 = true>> <</choice_shown>> /% [[prologue2]] %/<<if $tribe1>> Which tribe is your grandpa from? A strict man with a strange sense of humor, and some would say, eccentric even. You'll never know if it was the money that made him this way or if the old man was truly an oddball. <br><br> "<i>Was,</i>" past-tense. Two days ago, a heart attack got the better of grandpa $henry. Now he is gone, six feet under. Well, not quite in the ground yet. You're on your way to the family estate for the funeral. <br><br> The family estate used to be granpa's primary residence, and it's an old mansion that was built in the year 1960. You've visited it many times, and although equiped with modern appliances and decorated with style, the old house has always given you the creeps. <br><br> You would have gladly passed on the chance to visit again if it wasn't your only chance to say your last goodbye to the old man. <br><br> [[Next|prologue6]]It's also your chance to see the other family members, and to find out who will get all the money. Grandpa $henry had always joked that his entire fortune will go to one person and one person only, but no one knew which one of the surviving $surnamemc would get the jackpot. <br><br> The family lawyer had mentioned — in an email to everyone — that this information will be revealed after the funeral. More precisely, at the reading of the will. Such revelation — if true — is bound to create drama. Especially in a family that can barely stomach the sight of one another. <br><br> In a couple of hours, Grandpa will be laid to rest, and all suviving members of the $surnamemc are expected to attend. <br><br> It's hard to believe that the old man is really gone. The news of the passing of $henry $surnamemc came in when: <br><br> <<set _next = "prologue7">> <<choice_shown "I was getting bailed out of jail after a DUI." _next>> <<set $var1 = "Last I heard, you got arrested for being a drunk driver, no?">> <<set $var2 = "And my answer to that, dear cousin... is that it's none of your business.">> <<set $newz = 1>> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "I was partying on the rooftop of the most exclusive club in Dubai." _next>> <<set $var1 = "Last I heard, you were partying in an exclusive club in Dubai, and wasting your life away, no?">> <<set $var2 = "Well, dear cousin, at least I know how to live my life.">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "I was partying on an expensive yacht in the Maldives." _next>> <<set $var1 = "Last I heard, you were partying on an expensive yacht in the Maldives, and wasting your life away, no?">> <<set $var2 = "Well, dear cousin, at least I know how to live my life.">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "I was finalizing a deal with some new partners in Tokyo with the goal of setting up my own company." _next>> <<set $var1 = "Last I heard, you were finalizing a deal with some new partners in Tokyo. Are you trying to make more money for the family?">> <<set $var2 = "News travel fast! But all I can say about it is... I can't share the details of this deal with you, dear cousin.">> <<set $newz = 2>> <</choice_shown>> /% [[prologue7]] %/It's going to be fun seeing the family again. All of them gathered at that old mansion where the walls would tell horror stories if they could talk. <br><br> Your last visits to the estate were for the celebration of your father's birthday, and a year later for your grandpa's 80th birthday. And if your memory serves you right, there were enough drama during both of those visits to start a reality TV show you would name — Keeping Up With The $surnamemc! <br><br> Ah, yes. Seeing the family again is going to be fun. Especially knowing what the others think of you. <br><br> They have always referred to you as: <br><br> <<set _next = "firstname">> <<choice_shown "The black sheep of the family, always partying and spending money I'll never earn." _next>> <<set $nik = "blak">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "Grandpa's favorite grandchild. They have always been a bit jealous of my bond with the old man." _next>> <<set $nik = "fav">> <</choice_shown>> <<choice_shown "The odd one. to ChoiceScript's image syntax, but image file has to be included in the images folder <<image file alignment alt-text>> */ <<widget "image">> <<set _file = _args[0]>> <<set _align = _args[1]>> <<set _alt = _args[2]>> <<set _dir = setup.imgPath>> <<if _alt>> <img @class="_align" @src="_dir + _file" @alt="_alt"> <<elseif not (_align eq "left" or _align eq "right" or _align eq "center")>> <<set _alt = _align>> <img class="center" @src="_dir + _file" @alt="_alt"> <<elseif _align>> <img @class="_align" @src="_dir + _file"> <<else>> <img class="center" @src="_dir + _file"> <</if>> <</widget>> /* capitalize first letter of a given variable's content, default is to change the content, otherwise give parameter for change as "false" <<capfirst "$var" change>> */ <<widget "capfirst">> <<set _v = _args[0]>> <<if _args.length gt 1>> <<set _change = _args[1]>> <<else>> <<set _change = true>> <</if>> <<if _change and State.getVar(_v)>> <<run State.setVar(_v, State.getVar(_v).toUpperFirst())>> <<else>> <<print State.getVar(_v).toUpperFirst()>> <</if>> <</widget>> /* for when having a short line of text to a choice selection */ <<widget "text">> <<if $text neq "">>$text<br><br><</if>> <<set $text = "">> <</widget>> /* shorthand for creating a return button */ <<widget "returnbutton">> <<button "Return to Story" $return>><</button>> <</widget>> /* shorthand for setting up stat bar */ <<widget "statbar">> <<set _stat = _args[0]>> <<set _left = _args[1]>> <<if _args[2]>> <<set _right = _args[2]>> <<else>><<set _right = "">> <</if>> <<set _p = State.getVar(_stat)>> <<if _p>> <<if _right>> <<set _right = _right + "&nbsp;" + (100 - _p) + "%">> <</if>> <div class="stat-bar rounded"> <span class="value rounded" @style="'width: ' + _p + '%;'"> <span class="statbarlefttext">_left&nbsp;_p%</span> </span> <span class="statbarrighttext">_right</span> </div> <</if>> <</widget>><b>Personal Information</b> <br> <b>Name</b>: $namemc $surnamemc <br> <b>Also known as</b>: ?you_var of the family<br> <b>Pronouns</b>: $pronou<br> <b>Gender</b>: $gender<br> <b>Skin Color</b>: $Skintone<br> <b>Eyes color</b>: $Eyes<br> <b>Hair</b>: $type $Haircolor <br><br> <b><i>Personality</i></b><br> <<statbar "$brat1" "Modest" "Spoiled">> <<statbar "$kind1" "Kind" "Heartless">> <<statbar "$self1" "Selfless" "Selfish">> <br> <b>Bank Account</b>: <<= $money1 + $bil1>><br> <b>Money Donated</b>: <<= $moneyd + $bild>><br> <b>Money Invested</b>: <<= $money3 + $bil3>><br> <b>Money lost due to stock and bad investment</b>: <<= $money4 + $bil4>><br> <b>Money gained due to stock or good investment</b>: <<= $money5 + $bil5>><br> <<if $mom_ney>> $mom_ney<br> <</if>> <<if $bro_ney>> $bro_ney<br> <</if>> <<if $dad_ney>> $dad_ney<br> <</if>> <b>Personal Wealth & Assets</b><br> <ul> <<if $ass2>> <li>$ass2 $priceass2</li> <</if>> <<if $ass1>> <li>$ass1 $priceass1</li> <</if>> <<if $ass3>> <li>$ass3 $priceass3</li> <</if>> <<if $ass4>> <li>$ass4 $priceass4</li> <</if>> <<if $ass5>> <li>$ass5 $priceass5</li> <</if>> <<if $ass6>> <li>$ass6 $priceass6</li> <</if>> </ul> <b>Total In Assets</b>: <<= $money2 + $bil2>><br> <b>Relationship</b> <br><br> <b><i>The detective</i></b>: Detective<<if hasVisited("c1_det")>> Mars<</if>> <<statbar "$det_rel" "Relationship">> <<if $det_rom gt 10>> <<statbar "$det_rom" "Romance">> <</if>> <br> <b><i>The family lawyer</i></b>: $law_name Storks <<statbar "$law_rel" "Relationship">> <<if $law_rom gt 10>> <<statbar "$law_rom" "Romance">> <</if>> <br> <b><i>The bodyguard</i></b>: $bod_name <<statbar "$bod_rel" "Relationship">> <<if $bod_rom gt 10>> <<statbar "$bod_rom" "Romance">> <</if>> <br> <b><i>$ro1</i></b>: $sec_name <<statbar "$sec_rel" "Relationship">> <<if $sec_rom gt 10>> <<statbar "$sec_rom" "Romance">> <</if>> <br><br> <<link "🔍 Your list of clues.">> <<popup "stat_clues" "Clues">> <</link>> <br> <<link "🔍 The $surnamemc family members.">> <<popup "stat_family" "Family">> <</link>> <br> <<link "🔍 A rundown of your life.">> <<popup "stat_life" "Life">> <</link>> <br> <<link "🔍 Achievements">> <<popup "achievementview" "Achievements">> <</link>><<image "clu3.png" "clue board">> <br> <b>Keys Owned:</b> $keyz 🔑 <br><br> <<image "clu10.png" "right" "magnifying glass looking at footprints">> <b>Memories Of The Night It All Happened.</b><br> <b>1:</b> <i>$mem1</i><br> <b>2:</b> <i>$mem2</i><br> <b>3:</b> <i>$mem3</i><br> <b>4:</b> <i>$mem4</i><br> <b>5:</b> <i>$mem5</i> <br><br> <<image "clu10.png" "right" "magnifying glass looking at footprints">>
